alert.note: Alert for Franklin; Lincoln; Moore (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Freeze Warning issued November 01 at 1:35PM CDT until November 02 at 9:00AM CDT by NWS Huntsville
info.description: ...FREEZE WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM THIS EVENING TO 9 AM CDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Subfreezing temperatures in the 23 to 27 degree range for much of the region, but in the 28 to 32 degree range atop the Cumberland Plateau and in the immediate vicinity of large bodies of water. * WHERE...All counties in northern Alabama, as well as Lincoln, Moore and Franklin counties in southern middle Tennessee. * WHEN...From 11 PM this evening to 9 AM CDT Thursday. * IMPACTS...A hard, damaging freeze is likely for most of the region tonight, which will kill crops and other sensitive vegetation and could potentially damage unprotected outdoor plumbing. A widespread coverage of frost is also anticipated.
info.instruction: Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing.
